description: Calprotectin is an abundant heterodimeric calcium-binding protein belonging to the S100 family (S100A8 and S100A9), which inhibits metalloproteinases, and has antimicrobial and pro-apoptotic activities[1,2]. Calprotectin is present in neutrophils, monocytes/macrophages and potentially epithelial cells, and it comprises up to 60% of the total cytosolic protein content of neutrophils.
name: Calprotectin Antibodies and Antigens
